name: Shahar Maoz
content: Prof. Shahar Maoz, School of Computer Science and AI, Tel Aviv University Shahar Maoz's Homepage Shahar Maoz Research Lab Projects Publications Teaching Overview Shahar Maoz is a Professor at the School of Computer Science and AI in Tel Aviv University. He received his PhD from the Weizmann Institute of Science in 2009 and has been at Tel Aviv University since 2012. His research interest is in Software Engineering, specifically software and systems modeling, testing, formal specification languages, and synthesis. His work has been funded by an ERC Starting Grant (2015), an ERC Proof of Concept Grant (2022), an ISF Grant (2023), a BSF Grant (2025), and a DFG-ISF grant (2025). He spent sabbaticals in MIT CSAIL and in King's College London. He served as PC Co-Chair of ASE'22 main research track. Shahar co-organized the first International SPECS summer school in 2023 (SPECS23@TAU) and the second in 2025 (SPECS25@CMU). He co-organized a Dagstuhl Seminar on Specification Engineering in 2025. Shahar actively recruits new MSc students, PhD students, and post-docs. Positions come with full funding for a number of years. Please contact him for details.
